properties.name: Mare Tranquillitatis
properties.description: Site of the first Moon landing (Apollo 11). Formed by ancient volcanic eruptions that flooded an impact basin with basaltic lava.

properties.name: Mare Serenitatis
properties.description: One of the most circular maria. Connected to Mare Tranquillitatis. Contains mascons (mass concentrations) beneath its surface.

properties.name: Mare Imbrium
properties.description: Second largest mare on the Moon. Formed by a massive impact that created a basin later filled with lava. Surrounded by mountain ranges.
properties.formed: 3.85 billion years ago (impact), filled with lava until 3.3 billion years ago

properties.name: Oceanus Procellarum
properties.description: The largest mare on the Moon and the only one called 'oceanus'. Site of Apollo 12 landing. Unlike other maria, may not have formed from a single impact.

properties.name: Mare Nubium
properties.description: Located in the southwestern part of the near side. Contains several ghost craters â€“ craters nearly buried by lava.

properties.name: Mare Fecunditatis
properties.description: Located on the eastern edge of the near side. Site of Luna 16, the first robotic sample return mission.

properties.name: Mare Crisium
properties.description: Isolated mare near the Moon's eastern limb. Very distinct, one of the first features visible as the Moon waxes. Site of Luna 24.

properties.name: Mare Humorum
properties.description: Small, nearly circular mare in the southwest. Contains the prominent crater Gassendi on its northern rim.

properties.name: Mare Nectaris
properties.description: Small, well-defined mare. The Nectaris basin is one of the oldest dated lunar basins and defines the 'Nectarian' geological period.

properties.name: Mare Frigoris
properties.description: Long, irregular mare stretching across the northern part of the near side. Not formed from a single basin.

properties.name: Mare Vaporum
properties.description: Small mare near the center of the near side. Contains several rilles including Rima Hyginus.
